The Board of Trade sent an experienced officer to visit the Scottish fishing ports at the end of last year with instructions to go into the matter fully, and. he found that all parties, owners, shippers and fishermen were generally in favour of the extension.The effect of the extension will be to bring Scottish fishermen under the discipline sections of the Merchant Shipping Act and to provide for the. settlement of disputes between Scottish skippers and fishermen by Superintendents of Mercantile Marine Offices4 It will require agreements with the crews in the case of Scottish trawlers of 25 tons and upwards, together with an account cf wages for.each man and "a certificate cf discharge.The Bill makes an alteration in the law which is desired by the Scottish fishing industry, and is not likely to be opposed* We ask for sanction to its introduction.R4So HomeRobert Munro7th April, 1920* [10 Geo. 5.] Merchant Shipping (Scottish Fishing Boats). draft of ABILLTOProvide for the extension to Scotland of Part IV. of a.d. 1920 the Merchant Shipping Act, 1894.BE it enacted by the King's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows:-5 1.
